300,000 VND per person for one year.  According to the
Ho Chi Minh City Department of Health, for many years,
the number of medical staff at each
medical station has ranged from 5 to 10 people. On average, for
100 medical staff serving 30,000 people, a
medical staff must undertake many tasks.
This leads to not doing a good job of engaging the
community in conveying
media messages and mobilizing people to
participate in community health, so it is
necessary for community health collaborators
to be an extended arm for the community.
Ho Chi Minh City's primary health care system has become the
first locality in the country to
pilot the use of automatic load weighing equipment
to punish overloaded freight vehicles. Inspectors of
the Department of Transport will
determine  Based on the image of the truck loading results
to decide on a pilot penalty period
within 1
year, from November 10, the
Ho Chi Minh City Department of Transport
will pilot a cold penalty for overloaded vehicles with a penalty.
Automatic weighing at three weighing stations including
load checking station number 3 in the Cau Ong Lon area
on Nguyen Van Linh street,
vehicle load checking station number six and number 7 in the An
Suong An Lac toll station area, Binh
Tan district at two  At the beginning of the load check station,
two signs are installed to
detect violations after the vehicle
moves through the station. The information announcement will
show whether the results are overloaded or not.
Urban traffic management and operation center  Ho Chi Minh City City said the
first day of deployment was quite smooth, with
vehicles following the correct signs teaching
the correct lane, controlling the load,
recording 12 cases showing signs of violation. The
Center will extract images of license plates.
information sent to traffic inspectors to

overloaded vehicles. Recently, there have been many
difficulties in personnel and can cause
traffic jams, so the City Department of Transport
has developed  Launching a pilot program to
combat overloaded vehicles.

Ho Chi Minh City caught fire fiercely. The burned location
was located in a residential area.  Crowded

warehouses and parking lots, the firefighting force
tried their best to put out the fire and prevent it from burning.
Around 7 p.m., smoke and fire rose from the
warehouse in the alley on Be Van Ban street.
Tan Kien ward near Tan Thuan bridge A
nearby resident and factory staff
tried to put out the fire but failed, the
fire quickly flared up fiercely,
smoke rose tens of meters high, accompanied by
many explosions, the fire threatened the area.  The
surrounding residential area caused many people to
panic and evacuate their vehicles and property.
Fire prevention and rescue police.
Ho Chi Minh City Police sent nearly
20 fire trucks and more than 100 soldiers to the
scene of the attack.  The firefighting line
approached from many sides and sprayed water to control the
fire. By 9:30 p.m., the fire was
completely extinguished. The fire caused about 2,000
square meters of the company's area to burn down
many office equipment, electronic devices, and
cakes.  Bottled water candy burned down,
property damage has not yet been
estimated. Currently, the cause of the fire is being
investigated and

of 39
Vietnamese people who died in a refrigerated truck
in the Southeast of England in 2019 had 19
defendants convicted. In this trial,
eight defendants were  Vietnamese citizens,
other defendants are citizens of France,
China, aleri and
marok. Among the total of 19 defendants, four
Vietnamese were convicted of manslaughter and
sentenced to 9 to 10 years in prison. Four
other Vietnamese were among them.  Two people who were absent
and considered to be fugitives were sentenced to
1 to 10 years in prison for their roles in
transporting and providing accommodation for
illegal immigrants. Other subjects were
drivers or apartment owners.  The household connected
to this human trafficking ring received a
suspended prison sentence. Only one defendant, who was a
driver, was acquitted. Some defendants
claimed that they were forced to join
this ring. However, according to the Traffic Court,  The
main motive of the defendants was to
make a profit. Previously, on

before Lent.  Non-
Christians are not allowed to eat meat or drink alcohol, so
this is the time when these people have
fun before entering the time to

Carnival festival in the colon is always considered
